title: How to Bake Lemon Poppyseed Cake

methods.name: Making Tender Lemon Poppy Seed Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: You will be baking your tender lemon poppy seed cake in a standard oven. Before you make the cake, turn the oven on. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.

steps.headline: Prepare the pan.
steps.description: You will be baking your cake in a 9 inch (22.9 cm) round cake pan. Lightly grease the pan with butter. Then sprinkle the breadcrumbs on the pan. Tap off any excess breadcrumbs from the pan.

steps.headline: Combine the all purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder, and salt.
steps.description: Place each of these ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Use a whisk to gently mix together the ingredients. Stop whisking when the ingredients are completely combined.

steps.headline: Mix together the butter and granulated sugar in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Add the granulated sugar and butter to a large mixing bowl separate from the bowl of dry ingredients. Use a hand mixer to combine the butter and sugar. Mix at medium-high speed until the butter and sugar have formed a pale, fluffy mixture. This process should take about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the eggs to the butter and sugar.
steps.description: Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat them into the butter and sugar on medium-high speed. You should make sure you thoroughly beat the mixture in the time between adding the first and second eggs. This process should take about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients and milk.
steps.description: Turn your hand mixer to low speed. Add half of the dry ingredients and beat for 1 minute. Add the second half of the dry and the milk. Beat on low speed for 1 minute. If the ingredients do not appear to be completely combined, beat on low speed for an additional minute.

steps.headline: Fold in the lemon zest, poppy seeds, and lemon extract.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to gently fold the lemon extract, poppy seeds, and lemon zest into the cake mixture. Take the spatula and run it around the sides of the bowl, then along the base of the bowl. Then fold the cake mixture over on to itself. Repeat this series of motions until the ingredients are just combined.

steps.headline: Place the batter in the prepared cake pan.
steps.description: Use the rubber spatula to gently spoon the cake mixture into the cake pan. Be sure to scrape the batter from the sides of the bowl. Use the spatula to smooth the surface of the batter once it is in the pan.

steps.headline: Bake the cake.
steps.description: Place the cake pan in the oven that has been preheated to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius. Bake the cake at this temperature for 30 minutes, or until you can insert a toothpick in the middle of the cake and it comes out clean. Remove the cake from the oven.

steps.headline: Cool the cake.
steps.description: Carefully place the cake on a wire rack to cool by gently inverting the pan. The cake should gently slide out when you turn the cake pan upside down. Allow the cake to cool at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before transferring it to a serving plate.

steps.headline: Make the icing.
steps.description: In a medium sized bowl, combine the lemon juice and confectioners’ sugar. Stir with a spoon until the mixture turns into a runny glaze. This process should take about 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Glaze and serve the cake.
steps.description: Once the cake has cooled, but is still slightly warm to the touch, spread the glaze over the top of the cake with a rubber spatula. Allow the glaze to run over the sides of the cake. Be careful not to use too much force or you can damage the cake. Cut the cake into wedges and serve to grateful guests or family members.

methods.name: Making Lemon Poppy Seed Pound Cake

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: You will be baking your lemon poppy seed pound cake in a standard oven. Before you begin making the cake, turn your oven on and preheat it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.

steps.headline: Prepare the pan.
steps.description: Take a small amount of butter and grease the pan. Use your fingers to spread the butter evenly over the bottom and sides of the pan until it is completely greased. Set the pan aside.

steps.headline: Combine the lemon zest and granulated sugar.
steps.description: Add the granulated sugar and lemon zest to a medium sized mixing bowl. Use your fingers to combine the ingredients, rubbing them together until the mixture looks similar to sand.

steps.headline: Whisk in the eggs, 3 tablespoon of lemon juice, and the buttermilk.
steps.description: Once you’ve combined the lemon zest and granulated sugar, add the wet ingredients to the same bowl. Using a whisk in one hand, gently whisk while adding the eggs, 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice, and the buttermilk. Whisk until just combined, or about 90 seconds.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Set aside a large mixing bowl. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the large bowl. Whisk these dry ingredients together for about 1 minute, or until completely combined.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients into the egg, lemon juice, and buttermilk mixture.
steps.description: Whisk all these ingredients together for about 1 minute. Then gently whisk in the olive oil and poppy seeds. Whisk the batter for another minute.

steps.headline: Bake the cake.
steps.description: Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake the cake for 1 hour. You will know the cake is done when a toothpick comes out clean after you insert it in the middle of the cake.

steps.headline: Cool the cake.
steps.description: Remove the pan from the oven and let the pan cool until it is warm to the touch. Then gently turn the pan upside down on to a cooling rack. Once the cake emerges from the pan, gently flip the cake right side up.

steps.headline: Prepare the glaze.
steps.description: Using a whisk, mix together the remaining 4 teaspoons of lemon juice and the confectioners’ sugar. Whisk together until completely combined, which should take less than 1 minute. Be sure you whisk until any lumps are removed.

steps.headline: Glaze the cake.
steps.description: Dip a pastry brush in the glaze. Then gently glaze the cake. Spread the glaze evenly over the sides and top of the cake with the pastry brush. Cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve the cake.
steps.description: Once the cake has cooled completely, slice it into 2 inch (5.1 cm) thick slices. Serve and enjoy! You can store any uneaten cake in a glass or plastic container with a lid.

tyn: Making Tender Lemon Poppy Seed Cake
Making Lemon Poppy Seed Pound Cake
text: Making Tender Lemon Poppy Seed Cake Preheat the oven. You will be baking your tender lemon poppy seed cake in a standard oven. Before you make the cake, turn the oven on. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius. Prepare the pan. You will be baking your cake in a 9 inch (22.9 cm) round cake pan. Lightly grease the pan with butter. Then sprinkle the breadcrumbs on the pan. Tap off any excess breadcrumbs from the pan. Combine the all purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder, and salt. Place each of these ingredients in a medium sized bowl. Use a whisk to gently mix together the ingredients. Stop whisking when the ingredients are completely combined. Mix together the butter and granulated sugar in a separate bowl. Add the granulated sugar and butter to a large mixing bowl separate from the bowl of dry ingredients. Use a hand mixer to combine the butter and sugar. Mix at medium-high speed until the butter and sugar have formed a pale, fluffy mixture. This process should take about 2 minutes. Add the eggs to the butter and sugar. Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat them into the butter and sugar on medium-high speed. You should make sure you thoroughly beat the mixture in the time between adding the first and second eggs. This process should take about 2 minutes. Add the dry ingredients and milk. Turn your hand mixer to low speed. Add half of the dry ingredients and beat for 1 minute. Add the second half of the dry and the milk. Beat on low speed for 1 minute. If the ingredients do not appear to be completely combined, beat on low speed for an additional minute. Fold in the lemon zest, poppy seeds, and lemon extract. Use a rubber spatula to gently fold the lemon extract, poppy seeds, and lemon zest into the cake mixture. Take the spatula and run it around the sides of the bowl, then along the base of the bowl. Then fold the cake mixture over on to itself. Repeat this series of motions until the ingredients are just combined. Place the batter in the prepared cake pan. Use the rubber spatula to gently spoon the cake mixture into the cake pan. Be sure to scrape the batter from the sides of the bowl. Use the spatula to smooth the surface of the batter once it is in the pan. Bake the cake. Place the cake pan in the oven that has been preheated to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius. Bake the cake at this temperature for 30 minutes, or until you can insert a toothpick in the middle of the cake and it comes out clean. Remove the cake from the oven. Cool the cake. Carefully place the cake on a wire rack to cool by gently inverting the pan. The cake should gently slide out when you turn the cake pan upside down. Allow the cake to cool at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before transferring it to a serving plate. Make the icing. In a medium sized bowl, combine the lemon juice and confectioners’ sugar. Stir with a spoon until the mixture turns into a runny glaze. This process should take about 2 minutes. Glaze and serve the cake. Once the cake has cooled, but is still slightly warm to the touch, spread the glaze over the top of the cake with a rubber spatula. Allow the glaze to run over the sides of the cake. Be careful not to use too much force or you can damage the cake. Cut the cake into wedges and serve to grateful guests or family members. Making Lemon Poppy Seed Pound Cake Preheat the oven. You will be baking your lemon poppy seed pound cake in a standard oven. Before you begin making the cake, turn your oven on and preheat it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius. Prepare the pan. Take a small amount of butter and grease the pan. Use your fingers to spread the butter evenly over the bottom and sides of the pan until it is completely greased. Set the pan aside. Combine the lemon zest and granulated sugar. Add the granulated sugar and lemon zest to a medium sized mixing bowl. Use your fingers to combine the ingredients, rubbing them together until the mixture looks similar to sand. Whisk in the eggs, 3 tablespoon of lemon juice, and the buttermilk. Once you’ve combined the lemon zest and granulated sugar, add the wet ingredients to the same bowl. Using a whisk in one hand, gently whisk while adding the eggs, 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice, and the buttermilk. Whisk until just combined, or about 90 seconds. Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Set aside a large mixing bowl. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the large bowl. Whisk these dry ingredients together for about 1 minute, or until completely combined. Whisk the dry ingredients into the egg, lemon juice, and buttermilk mixture. Whisk all these ingredients together for about 1 minute. Then gently whisk in the olive oil and poppy seeds. Whisk the batter for another minute. Bake the cake. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake the cake for 1 hour. You will know the cake is done when a toothpick comes out clean after you insert it in the middle of the cake. Cool the cake. Remove the pan from the oven and let the pan cool until it is warm to the touch. Then gently turn the pan upside down on to a cooling rack. Once the cake emerges from the pan, gently flip the cake right side up. Prepare the glaze. Using a whisk, mix together the remaining 4 teaspoons of lemon juice and the confectioners’ sugar. Whisk together until completely combined, which should take less than 1 minute. Be sure you whisk until any lumps are removed. Glaze the cake. Dip a pastry brush in the glaze. Then gently glaze the cake. Spread the glaze evenly over the sides and top of the cake with the pastry brush. Cool completely. Serve the cake. Once the cake has cooled completely, slice it into 2 inch (5.1 cm) thick slices. Serve and enjoy! You can store any uneaten cake in a glass or plastic container with a lid. Finished.
sentences: Making Tender Lemon Poppy Seed Cake Preheat the oven.
You will be baking your tender lemon poppy seed cake in a standard oven.
Before you make the cake, turn the oven on.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.
Prepare the pan.
You will be baking your cake in a 9 inch (22.9 cm) round cake pan.
Lightly grease the pan with butter.
Then sprinkle the breadcrumbs on the pan.
Tap off any excess breadcrumbs from the pan.
Combine the all purpose flour, cake flour, baking powder, and salt.
Place each of these ingredients in a medium sized bowl.
Use a whisk to gently mix together the ingredients.
Stop whisking when the ingredients are completely combined.
Mix together the butter and granulated sugar in a separate bowl.
Add the granulated sugar and butter to a large mixing bowl separate from the bowl of dry ingredients.
Use a hand mixer to combine the butter and sugar.
Mix at medium-high speed until the butter and sugar have formed a pale, fluffy mixture.
This process should take about 2 minutes.
Add the eggs to the butter and sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat them into the butter and sugar on medium-high speed.
You should make sure you thoroughly beat the mixture in the time between adding the first and second eggs.
This process should take about 2 minutes.
Add the dry ingredients and milk.
Turn your hand mixer to low speed.
Add half of the dry ingredients and beat for 1 minute.
Add the second half of the dry and the milk.
Beat on low speed for 1 minute.
If the ingredients do not appear to be completely combined, beat on low speed for an additional minute.
Fold in the lemon zest, poppy seeds, and lemon extract.
Use a rubber spatula to gently fold the lemon extract, poppy seeds, and lemon zest into the cake mixture.
Take the spatula and run it around the sides of the bowl, then along the base of the bowl.
Then fold the cake mixture over on to itself.
Repeat this series of motions until the ingredients are just combined.
Place the batter in the prepared cake pan.
Use the rubber spatula to gently spoon the cake mixture into the cake pan.
Be sure to scrape the batter from the sides of the bowl.
Use the spatula to smooth the surface of the batter once it is in the pan.
Bake the cake.
Place the cake pan in the oven that has been preheated to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.
Bake the cake at this temperature for 30 minutes, or until you can insert a toothpick in the middle of the cake and it comes out clean.
Remove the cake from the oven.
Cool the cake.
Carefully place the cake on a wire rack to cool by gently inverting the pan.
The cake should gently slide out when you turn the cake pan upside down.
Allow the cake to cool at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before transferring it to a serving plate.
Make the icing.
In a medium sized bowl, combine the lemon juice and confectioners’ sugar.
Stir with a spoon until the mixture turns into a runny glaze.
This process should take about 2 minutes.
Glaze and serve the cake.
Once the cake has cooled, but is still slightly warm to the touch, spread the glaze over the top of the cake with a rubber spatula.
Allow the glaze to run over the sides of the cake.
Be careful not to use too much force or you can damage the cake.
Cut the cake into wedges and serve to grateful guests or family members.
Making Lemon Poppy Seed Pound Cake Preheat the oven.
You will be baking your lemon poppy seed pound cake in a standard oven.
Before you begin making the cake, turn your oven on and preheat it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit or 177 degrees Celsius.
Prepare the pan.
Take a small amount of butter and grease the pan.
Use your fingers to spread the butter evenly over the bottom and sides of the pan until it is completely greased.
Set the pan aside.
Combine the lemon zest and granulated sugar.
Add the granulated sugar and lemon zest to a medium sized mixing bowl.
Use your fingers to combine the ingredients, rubbing them together until the mixture looks similar to sand.
Whisk in the eggs, 3 tablespoon of lemon juice, and the buttermilk.
Once you’ve combined the lemon zest and granulated sugar, add the wet ingredients to the same bowl.
Using a whisk in one hand, gently whisk while adding the eggs, 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice, and the buttermilk.
Whisk until just combined, or about 90 seconds.
Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Set aside a large mixing bowl.
Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt to the large bowl.
Whisk these dry ingredients together for about 1 minute, or until completely combined.
Whisk the dry ingredients into the egg, lemon juice, and buttermilk mixture.
Whisk all these ingredients together for about 1 minute.
Then gently whisk in the olive oil and poppy seeds.
Whisk the batter for another minute.
Bake the cake.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan.
Bake the cake for 1 hour.
You will know the cake is done when a toothpick comes out clean after you insert it in the middle of the cake.
Cool the cake.
Remove the pan from the oven and let the pan cool until it is warm to the touch.
Then gently turn the pan upside down on to a cooling rack.
Once the cake emerges from the pan, gently flip the cake right side up.
Prepare the glaze.
Using a whisk, mix together the remaining 4 teaspoons of lemon juice and the confectioners’ sugar.
Whisk together until completely combined, which should take less than 1 minute.
Be sure you whisk until any lumps are removed.
Glaze the cake.
Dip a pastry brush in the glaze.
Then gently glaze the cake.
Spread the glaze evenly over the sides and top of the cake with the pastry brush.
Cool completely.
Serve the cake.
Once the cake has cooled completely, slice it into 2 inch (5.1 cm) thick slices.
Serve and enjoy!
You can store any uneaten cake in a glass or plastic container with a lid.
Finished.
